page.title: 12King's School - Cadet Force.
page.content: On Friday, 7 June 1985, the Combined Cadet Force celebrated its 75th Anniversary. In 1910, the Contingent had just 2 officers and 36 cadets, but in 1985, there are 11 officers and 238 cadets. To celebrate the Anniversary, the Contingent was inspected by Field Marshal Sir Edwin Bramall, GCB, OBE, MC, Chief of the Defence Staff. He also presented the Contingent with its own Standard, which depicts the School crest on a field of dark blue, with the CCF badge in the hoist corner. Once the formal side of the day was over, all the Guests and Parents were invited to inspect static displays, which showed the many aspects of CCF training - map reading, drill, shooting, campcraft, fieldcraft, signals, vehicle maintenance and RAF skills.
